header.title: NAOS: A Practical Guide to Modern Magick

central_thesis: The work provides a self-contained and practical guide to esoteric magick based on the Septenary tradition, aiming to achieve individual freedom, liberation, and insight through a structured 'seven-fold Way'. It encompasses both 'Internal Magick' for personal development and 'External Magick' for influencing external events and individuals.

structure_content.chapter_title: Part One Physis Magick: Practical Guide to Becoming an Adept
structure_content.summary: This part outlines the 'seven-fold Way', a progressive path to Adeptship and beyond. It introduces a theory of magick based on acausal energies and their manifestation in the causal universe. Each of the five stages (Initiation, Second Degree Initiation, External Adept, Internal Adept, Entering the Abyss) details specific Grade Rituals, studies, and tasks, including meditative workings with Septenary spheres and the construction and play of the Star Game. A custom-made Sinister Tarot is described for symbolic and practical use.

Focusing on 'External Magick', this section details various practical techniques for manifesting desires. It covers Esoteric Chant (vibration of names and musical modes), Frenzy Magick (inducing and directing acausal energies through physical and emotional states), Visualization and Sigil Magick (mental imagery and Star Game patterns), Sexual Magick (channelling sexual energy for magical aims), Model Magick (using physical or artistic representations), Empathic Magick (identifying with persons or forces), and Dark Pathways (invoking 'dark' entities for specific workings). It also discusses the nature of the 'Dark Gods' and 'Star Gates'.

The appendix elaborates on core concepts, including the Left Hand Path (defined as internal magick revealing Chaos/non-Being), the Septenary System (its three-dimensional structure and tripartite spheres), and visualization techniques. It provides an extensive collection of Magickal Symbols and Scripts (sigils, runes) and a table of correspondences for planets/spheres. An alternative Hermetic Ritual of Self-Initiation is given, along with guidelines for preparing for any Hermetic ritual.

This part presents selected esoteric manuscripts covering advanced theoretical aspects and practical applications. Topics include 'The Wheel of Life' (zodiacal and seasonal correspondences), 'Notes on Esoteric Tradition' (Septenary, Star Gates, Acausal/Causal definitions, Archetypes), 'Attributions of the Runes', 'Musick, Incense, Forms' (correspondences), 'Symbols and Being' (Heideggerian philosophy applied to acausal), 'Time and Being', 'Advanced Star Game', and 'The Forbidden Alchemy' (connecting sexual elements and self-experiencing to the seven-fold Way).

key_concepts.definition: A hitherto secret esoteric tradition based on a seven-fold system, represented by the 'Tree of Wyrd' and its spheres and pathways, used as a practical guide to magick and consciousness evolution.

A parallel universe, or universes, intersecting our causal universe, serving as the source of magickal energies. It is described by an unspecified number of spatial dimensions and non-linear time, contrasting with the causal universe.
The phenomenal universe experienced through the five senses, characterized by three spatial dimensions and linear time, and governed by the laws of physics.
The use of acausal energies to bring about psychic and internal changes, primarily for personal development and the evolution of consciousness, exemplified by the 'seven-fold Way'.
The use of acausal energies, directed by individual desire, to manifest changes in events, circumstances, or other individuals within the causal universe.

The core internal magick path in the Septenary tradition, comprising seven progressive stages from Initiation to Immortal, each involving specific Grade Rituals, studies, and practices like the Star Game, aimed at expanding individual consciousness and achieving Adeptship.

An esoteric tool consisting of seven boards and distinct pieces, serving to develop higher levels of consciousness, act as a new form of magickal working, and aid in concentration and visualization. It symbolizes the Septenary Tree of Wyrd and the interplay of causal and acausal energies.

A conceptual and experiential region within the Septenary system, located between the spheres of the Sun and Mars, where the acausal and causal meet. It represents a profound ordeal that breaks the individual's self-image, leading to either destruction or the 'real beginnings of wisdom' beyond dualities.

Symbolic 'zones of energy' that link the seven spheres of the Septenary Tree of Wyrd. These pathways are associated with 'dark' or chthonic energies, and their invocation is a means of conscious integration and external magickal workings within the Left Hand Path tradition.

Esoterically defined as an apprehension, conscious or unconscious, of acausal energies by an individual. It is presented to consciousness through psychic processes such as dreams, inspirational art, or the perception of real persons in an archetypal way.
That aspect of the individual psyche whose perception is limited to immediate concerns and needs, often swayed by unconscious desires and in thrall to archetypes.

The stage of individual development beyond the 'ego', characterized by an apprehension of one's 'wyrd' (fate/destiny) and empathy with other individuals, leading to 'individuation' and ultimately Adeptship.

practical_system.description: The system is centered on the 'seven-fold Way' for Internal Magick and 'Esoteric Sorcery' for External Magick, rooted in the Septenary Tradition. Progression involves a series of 'Grade Rituals' aligned with spheres of the 'Tree of Wyrd', each stage demanding specific studies, meditations, and practical tasks designed for self-development. The Star Game serves as a central meditative and operative tool, symbolizing cosmic energies and individual consciousness. The system emphasizes direct experience, self-honesty, and the disciplined application of various magical techniques, from solitary visualizations to group rituals and physical ordeals, all aimed at achieving insight, Adeptship, and mastery over causal and acausal forces.
tools: Various incenses (Petriochor, Sulphur, Sandalwood, Oak, Musk, Civit, Henbane)
rituals: Stage One: Initiation (Full Moon ritual, sigil visualization, blood inscription, sphere meditations)
Stage Two: Second Degree Initiation (New Moon ritual with companion, quartz crystal, sexual union for energy, difficult physical goal)
Stage Three: External Adept (New Moon vigil outdoors, Star Game practice, companion sphere workings)
Stage Four: Internal Adept (Three-month isolation, self-sufficiency, personal task)
Stage Five: Entering the Abyss (Long-distance walk, crystal tetrahedron, bathing, 'Chaos' chant, darkness visualization)
Hermetic Ritual of Self-Initiation (Alternative to Stage One)
Esoteric Chant (Vibration of names, monophonic chant using Greek modes for specific aims)
Frenzy Magick (Dance, willed concentration, physical endurance, induced ecstasy to channel acausal energies)
Sexual Magick (Heterosexual and Sapphic/Uranian workings for energy generation and direction)
Model Magick (Creation of physical or artistic models for influence)
Empathic Magick (Identification with persons or natural forces for control)
Dark Pathway Invocations (Vibration/chant of specific entities with sigil concentration)

relevant_quotes.text: The purpose of the present work is to provide a self-contained and practical guide to esoteric magick based upon the Septenary tradition. This hitherto secret tradition (also known as hebdomadry) is here published for the first time.
External magick is the use of such energies, directed by individual desire, to bring about changes in the causal; Internal Magick is the use of these energies to bring psychic, internal change.
Internal magick is the following of the Occult path from Initiation to Adeptship and beyond, and in the Septenary tradition this path is known as the ‘seven-fold Way’.
Of all Occult traditions, the Septenary is perhaps the most practical and direct as a means of attaining this insight.
All genuine Black Magick is an act of defiance against the restrictions imposed by the mediocre and the cowards, and in this sense (as well as others) the Star game is an act of supreme Black Magick.
The Abyss lies between the spheres of Sun and Mars – it is the region where the ‘acausal’ and the ‘causal’ meet.

The essence of the genuine LHP – and this includes the Dark (or sinister) Tradition and traditional Satanism – is the use of magickal energies to enhance the evolution of the individual. Such evolution cannot exist outside the LHP as a willed act.

critical_analysis.relevance: NAOS is a foundational text for a distinct current within modern esotericism, presenting the Septenary Tradition as a unique and comprehensive magical system. Its primary relevance lies in providing a highly structured, practical, and demanding path to self-transformation and external influence, explicitly distinguishing between 'internal' and 'external' magick. The work innovatively integrates various occult disciplines, such as ceremonial magick, alchemical processes, and a reinterpretation of Jungian psychological concepts, all unified under the Star Game. Its emphasis on direct experience, self-honesty, and rigorous physical/psychological ordeals, rather than mere theoretical study or dogma, sets it apart from many other grimoire traditions. The author's clear articulation of concepts like the 'acausal' and the 'Left Hand Path' (LHP) redefines LHP as a process of conscious evolution through confrontation with 'non-Being' and Chaos, challenging conventional moralistic interpretations.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience consists of serious practitioners and academic researchers in Western Esotericism and Occultism, particularly those interested in practical, operative magick systems. It is highly suitable for individuals drawn to Left Hand Path philosophies, seeking a non-dogmatic and self-initiatory path that demands significant personal commitment, intellectual rigor, and physical endurance. Given its association, it is also essential for those studying the Order of Nine Angles (ONA) and related currents in contemporary esotericism, providing a detailed understanding of its core theoretical and practical frameworks.
